intro: Cladomyza microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved cladomyza, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are small, narrow, and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are yellow and daisy-like. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
